meanings.definition: Relating to the branch of chemistry that deals with the study of chemical reactions using electrical methods.
meanings.sent1: The electroanalytical experiment required the use of electricity to study chemical reactions.
meanings.sent2: Scientists conducted an electroanalytical study to understand how electricity affects chemical processes.
meanings.sent3: During the electroanalytical investigation, the chemist accidentally shocked themselves with a small battery.
meanings.sent4: The electroanalytical approach shed light on the hidden electrical properties of the chemical compounds.
meanings.sent5: The students found the electroanalytical demonstration fascinating as they watched the effects of electricity on different substances.

meanings.definition: Involving the use of electrical techniques to analyze chemical substances.
meanings.sent1: The electroanalytical equipment helped in analyzing the chemical composition of the sample.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician used electroanalytical methods to identify the unknown substance.
meanings.sent3: The electroanalytical process revealed surprising results about the chemical makeup of the solution.
meanings.sent4: By employing electroanalytical tools, researchers could accurately determine the components of the mixture.
meanings.sent5: The electroanalytical approach provided valuable insights into the nature of the chemical compounds under study.
